overview: From 2025-10-01 to 2025-11-01, Sendo-labs/sendo-api had 3 new PRs (3 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Update README.md to En
topPRs.author: tionebDotsamapha
topPRs.body: @xdrkush i traslated your readme in english if you want to merge it.

completedItems.title: Update README.md to En
completedItems.body: @xdrkush i traslated your readme in english if you want to merge it.

topContributors.summary: Neysixx: This month, Neysixx drove a foundational refactor of the Sendo-labs/frontend repository to improve its project structure and configurations. Their most impactful contribution was a massive structural overhaul (Sendo-labs/frontend#1), which involved over 17,800 lines added and 16,100 lines removed. They also improved the application's page structure (Sendo-labs/frontend#3) and resolved a critical build failure by adding missing dependencies (Sendo-labs/frontend#5). This activity demonstrates a clear focus on large-scale refactoring and feature work within the frontend codebase.

standujar: Focused on foundational development, standujar initiated several new projects and features this month by merging five pull requests. They established the initial implementation for a new cryptoscore plugin (plugin-cryptoscore#1) and set up the frontend project with Eliza integration (frontend#2), with these two efforts representing significant foundational work. Additionally, they initialized and expanded the contributor tracking system in the leaderboard repository (leaderboard#1, #2, #3). Their commits were primarily focused on feature work and other foundational tasks, with changes split between code and configuration files.

xdrkush: Made foundational contributions to the `sendo-api` repository this month, initiating the project with a massive PR (#1) that introduced over 21,000 lines of code. They also addressed a key functional issue by fixing the "buy sell account" logic in PR #3. Their activity shows a primary focus on building out the new service, with work spanning foundational setup, feature implementation, and bug fixes.

M4XGO: This month, M4XGO focused on establishing foundational CI/CD infrastructure by creating a new reusable workflow system in Sendo-labs/reusable-workflows#1, a significant effort involving over 1000 lines of code. They immediately demonstrated the impact of this work by implementing the new release management and NPM publishing workflow in the Sendo-labs/plugin-cryptoscore repository via PR #2. Their contributions were concentrated in configuration and documentation files, reflecting a clear focus on improving development processes and automation.

0xCanet: This month, 0xCanet's work was dedicated to establishing the foundation for a new project, `Sendo-labs/frontend`. This was accomplished through a single, significant pull request (#1) that served as the initial commit, adding over 9,200 lines of code to the new repository.

0domart: This month, 0domart focused on developing new functionality in the Sendo-labs/spotlight repository, opening a pull request to implement SOL transfer logic and unit tests (Sendo-labs/spotlight#1). This work-in-progress involved substantial code changes (+1527/-617 lines across 12 files). The contribution shows a primary focus on building out test coverage for this new feature.

tionebDotsamapha: Focused on improving project documentation this month, contributing an update to the `Sendo-labs/sendo-api` repository's README file (PR #2). This change, which translated the documentation to English, made the project more accessible. Their activity for the period was concentrated entirely on documentation.
